Chris Downey wrote:

> Thanks to everybody (Cedric, Elliotte, James, Adam, Paul and J.B.) for
> helping me out.  I've learned alot from this thread.  And - I've
> ordered JUnit Recipes from Amazon.

Mmmmm.... beer....

> Having just started with JUnit and with the idea of writing tests for
> all of my code, I must say that I'm delighted with the results.  Oh -
> I'm not writing much new code.  Most of the unit tests are for code
> that already exists for which I'm fixing bugs.

Good luck with that. I strongly recommend you also try to test-drive a 
bunch of code, because that will teach you the goal for refactoring the 
legacy stuff. If you don't know where you're going, how do you know you 
got there?

> I really can't imagine going back to not writing tests.  Now the thing
> I need to do next is figure out how to build support for running a
> suite of tests as part of our build process and getting our other
> developers to create and run tests, too.

If I write too much code without tests, I feel physical symptoms, like 
tightness in my chest. One day it'll be a heart attack, but for now it's 
garden-variety anxiety. Of course, I'm a bit of a nut.

Take care.
-- 
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
